name: Feature Sets
description:
As a framework user
In order to specify an ordered list of feature files to run with minimal repetition
I define a FeatureSet and its contents, which are either feature files or other feature sets

steps.name: I have defined feature sets configuration thusly:
I query for a json array of feature files names for the "root" feature set
I get a json array that looks like this:
the cluster has MapR Installed
I install maven on a non-cldb node
I copy the maven settings file to the non-cldb node
I install git on the non-cldb node
I create the user "m7user1" with id "5024" group "m7group1" and password "m7user1"
I create the user "m7user2" with id "5026" group "m7group1" and password "m7user2"
I create the user "m7user3" with id "5027" group "m7group2" and password "m7user3"
I create the user "m7user4" with id "5028" group "m7group1" and password "m7user4"
I add the user "m7user4" to secondary group "m7group1"
I create the user "mapruser1" with id "5029" group "mapruser1" and password "mapruser1"
I create the user "mapruser2" with id "5030" group "mapruser2" and password "mapruser2"
I create a MapR auth ticket for the "mapruser1" user with password "mapruser1" on all nodes
I create a MapR auth ticket for the "mapruser2" user with password "mapruser2" on all nodes
I create a MapR auth ticket for the "m7user1" user with password "m7user1" on all nodes
I create a MapR auth ticket for the "m7user2" user with password "m7user2" on all nodes
I create a MapR auth ticket for the "m7user3" user with password "m7user3" on all nodes
I create a MapR auth ticket for the "m7user4" user with password "m7user4" on all nodes
I set the git ssh key
I clone ATS on the node from "git@github.com:mapr/private-qa.git"
I remove the git ssh key
I setup passwordless ssh from non-cldb node to all other nodes
I set StrictHostKeyChecking option to no on non-cldb node
I perform the following ssh commands on each node in the cluster:

doc_string.value:
#Give root user the permission to execute YARN jobs
sed -i 's/allowed.system.users=mapr/allowed.system.users=root,mapr/g' /opt/mapr/hadoop/hadoop-2.7.0/etc/hadoop/container-executor.cfg

steps.name: the Cluster Under Test is managed by ESXI
the Operating Systems of each node match what is configured
I revert the cluster to its configured "readyForInstallation" state
I wait "45" seconds
the cluster does not have MapR Installed

elements.name: Use Web Interface to Install MapR with Spyglass Components

steps.name: the GUI Installer web server is running
I can authenticate my browser using the GUI Installer Login Page
I indicate I want a basic installation with Spyglass components and their dependencies only
the website indicates that the installation succeeds within "5" minutes

elements.name: Installation via Package Manager and Configure.sh

steps.name: the cluster does not have MapR Installed
I prepare each node in the cluster with the correct repo configuration
I perform the following ssh commands on each node in the cluster:

doc_string.value:
id -u mapr || groupadd -g 500 mapr
id -u mapr || useradd -u 500 -g mapr mapr

steps.name: I have updated the package manager
I have installed Java
I install the Core components
I prepare each node with the patch repo configuration
I have updated the package manager
I install the latest patch
I prepare the disk.list file
I run configure.sh on all nodes with only -C and -Z without -F
I wait "45" seconds
I perform the following ssh commands on each node in the cluster:
I wait "45" seconds
I start zookeeper on all the nodes
I perform the following ssh commands on each node in the cluster:
I wait "90" seconds
I restart the warden
the cluster has MapR Installed

elements.name: Installation via Package Manager and Configure.sh

steps.name: the cluster does not have MapR Installed
I perform the following ssh commands on each node in the cluster:

doc_string.value:
id -u mapr || groupadd -g 5000 mapr

steps.name: I have updated the package manager
I have installed Java
I install packages with the "core" tag
I install packages with the "patch" tag
I install packages with the "ecosystem" tag
I prepare the disk.list file
I run configure.sh on all nodes
I wait for cldb service to come up
I install the license on cluster
I install packages with the "spyglass" tag
I run configure.sh for spyglass components
I wait "30" seconds
I "restart" all "mapr-warden" services
I wait for cldb service to come up
all health checkable services are healthy

elements.name: Installation via Package Manager and Configure.sh

steps.name: the cluster does not have MapR Installed
I prepare each node in the cluster with the correct repo configuration
I perform the following ssh commands on each node in the cluster:

doc_string.value:

steps.name: I have updated the package manager
I have installed Java
I install the Core components
I prepare each node with the patch repo configuration
I have updated the package manager
I install the latest patch
I prepare the disk.list file
I run configure.sh on all nodes
I wait "45" seconds
I install the license on cluster
I set the mfs instance to "2"
I remove the opensource repo
I prepare each node with the spyglass repo configuration
I have updated the package manager
I install all spyglass components
I run configure.sh for spyglass components
I wait "60" seconds
I restart the warden
I wait "120" seconds
all health checkable services are healthy

elements.name: Installation via Package Manager and Configure.sh

steps.name: the cluster does not have MapR Installed
I create the user "mapr" with id "5000" group "mapr" and password "mapr"
I have updated the package manager
I have installed Java
I install packages with the "core" tag
I install packages with the "ecosystem" tag
I prepare the disk.list file
I run configure.sh with genkeys and nostart option on first cldb node
I copy cldb key file to all other cldb nodes and zookeeper nodes
I copy maprserverticket, ssl_keystore, ssl_truststore to all nodes
I run configure.sh with secure option on all nodes except first cldb node
I "start" all "mapr-zookeeper" services
I perform the following ssh commands on each node in the cluster:
I create a MapR auth ticket for the "root" user with password "mapr" on all nodes with timeout
I create a MapR auth ticket for the "mapr" user with password "mapr" on all nodes
I wait for cldb service to come up
I install the license on cluster
I install packages with the "spyglass" tag
I run configure.sh for spyglass components
I "restart" all "mapr-warden" services
I wait for cldb service to come up
all health checkable services are healthy
the cluster has MapR Installed
I remove all non-core components
I perform the following ssh commands on each node in the cluster:
I "stop" all "mapr-zookeeper" services
I remove all the core components
I clear all mapr data
the cluster does not have MapR Installed
the cluster does not have MapR Installed
I ssh into the node hosting "mapr-installer"
within my ssh session, I download "/mapr-setup.sh" to "/tmp" from the repository for the "mapr-installer" package family
within my ssh session, I execute "/tmp/mapr-setup.sh -y -u [installerRepoURL] [maprCoreRepoURL] [ecosystemRepoURL]"
I wait "15" seconds
it successfully starts the installer web server and outputs its URL to the screen

elements.name: Use REST APIs to Install MapR with Spyglass Components

steps.name: I can authenticate my GUI Installer Rest Client
I specify and save the desired Cluster Configuration
I perform Cluster Configuration Verification
I perform Cluster Provisioning
I perform Cluster Installation

name: Releasing
description:
As a Test Framework User
In order to test against the exact set of component versions and their corresponding promotion levels
I use the releases capability of the packaging library

steps.name: I am using a packageSets collection based on the following configuration:
I am using a releases collection based on the following configuration:
I ask for packages for the "active-beta" phase of the "example-release" release
package "0" is named "example1" with version "1.1", promotionLevel "active-beta"
package "1" is named "example2" with version "1.2", promotionLevel "active-beta"
package "2" is named "example3" with version "1.3", promotionLevel "active-beta"
package "3" is named "example4" with version "latest", promotionLevel "production"

name: Repositories
description:
As a Test Framework User
In order to determine the appropriate repository url for a given package version, promotion level and OS
I use the repositories capability of the packaging library

elements.name: Get list of packages in a repository

steps.name: I am using a packageSets collection based on the following configuration:
I am using a repositories collection based on the following configuration:
I ask for the packages with repository url "http://repositoryUrl"
package "0" is named "example1" with version "1.1", promotionLevel "dev" and operating system "redhat"
package "1" is named "example2" with version "1.2", promotionLevel "dev" and operating system "redhat"
package "2" is named "example3" with version "1.3", promotionLevel "dev" and operating system "redhat"
package "3" is named "somePackage" with version "1.1.0", promotionLevel "production" and operating system "ubuntu"
I want the "1.1" version of the "example1" package
I want the version that was promoted to the "dev" level of the development lifecycle
I am using the "centos" operating system
I ask for the repository
the repository has the correct url of "http://repositoryUrl"
I scp "./data/fixtures/esxi-snapshot.txt" to "10.10.30.147" at path "/tommy"
I download "/root/.profile" from "10.10.30.147" to "./data/tmp/cldb.key"
